1.text: And after these the Lord showed forth other seventy, and sent them together two and two before his face into every city and place, where he was about to come.

2.text: Then said he to them, Truly the harvest much, and the laborers few: implore therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he would send forth laborers into his harvest.

3.text: Retire: behold, I send you as lambs in the midst of wolves.

4.text: Carry no purse, nor wallet, nor shoes: and greet none by the way.

5.text: And in whatever house ye enter, first say, Peace to this house.

6.text: And if truly the son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it: and if not so, it shall turn back to you.

7.text: And remain in the same house, eating and drinking the things of them: for the laborer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.

8.text: And in whatever city ye enter, and they receive you, eat the things set before you.

9.text: And cure the sick in it, and say to them, The kingdom of God has drawn near to you.

10.text: And in whatever city ye enter, and they receive you not, having gone into its spacious ways, say,

11.text: And the dust having cleaved to us from your city, we wipe off to you but know this, that the kingdom of God has drawn nigh to you.

12.text: And I say to you, that it shall be more supportable in that day for Sodom, than for that city.

13.text: Woe to thee Chorazin! woe to thee Bethsaida! for if in Tyre and Sidon were the powers having been in you, long since had they changed the mind, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.

14.text: But for Tyre and Sidon shall it be more supportable in judgment, than for you.

15.text: And thou, Capernaum, indeed even lifted up to heaven, shalt be cast down to hades.

16.text: He hearing you hears me: and he rejecting you rejects me; and he rejecting me rejects him having sent me.

17.text: And the seventy returned with joy, saying, Lord, and the demons are subject to us in thy name.

18.text: And he said to them, I saw Satan as lightning fallen from heaven.

19.text: Behold, I give you power to tread above serpents and scorpions, and upon all the power of the enemy: and nothing shall hurt you.

20.text: But in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subject to you; but rather rejoice, that your names were written in the heavens.

21.text: In that hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit, and said, I will acknowledge to thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that thou hast hid these things from the wise and intelligent, and hast revealed them to babes: yes Father, for so was it benevolence before thee.

22.text: All things were delivered me by my Father: and none knows who is the Son, but the Father; and who the Father is, but the Son, and to whomsoever the Son would wish to reveal.

23.text: And having turned to the disciples apart he said, Happy the eyes seeing what ye see:

24.text: For I say to you, that many prophets and kings wished to behold what ye see, and saw not; and to hear what ye hear, and heard not.

25.text: And, behold, a certain skilled in the law stood up, tempting him, and saying, Teacher, what having done shall I inherit eternal life?

26.text: And he said to him, What has been written in the law? how readest thou?

27.text: And he having answered, said. Thou shalt love the Lord thy God from thy whole heart, and from thy whole soul, and from thy whole strength; and thy neighbor as thyself.

28.text: And he said to him, Thou hast answered rightly; this do and thou shalt live.

29.text: And he, wishing to justify himself, said to Jesus, And who is my neighbor?

30.text: And Jesus having replied said, A certain man went down from Jerusalem to Jericho, and fell among robbers: and having stripped him, and laid on blows, they departed, leaving him half dead.

31.text: And by accident a certain priest went down in that way: and having seen him, went on the opposite side.

32.text: And likewise also a Levite, having been in the place, having come and seen him, went on the opposite side.

33.text: And a certain Samaritan, traveling, came to him: and having seen him, felt compassion.

34.text: And having come near, he bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine, and having mounted him upon his own animal, he brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

35.text: And upon the morrow, he having come forth, taking out two drachmas, he gave to the inn-keeper, and said to him, Take care of him; and whatever thou spendest besides, I, in my coming back, will repay thee.

36.text: Which then of these three seems to thee to have been neighbor to him fallen among robbers?

37.text: And he said, He having done mercy with him. Then said Jesus to him. Go thou, and do likewise.

38.text: And it was in their going forth, and he came to a certain town: and a certain woman by the name of Martha received him in her house.

39.text: And also a sister was to her, called Mary; and she having sat at Jesusâ€™ feet, heard his word.

40.text: And Martha was perplexed about much service, and having stood before, said, Lord, carest thou not that my sister left me to serve alone? Speak therefore to her that she may lay hold and assist with me.

41.text: And Jesus having answered, said to her, Martha, Martha, thou hast care, and art confused about many things:

42.text: And of one thing there is need: and Mary has chosen the good part which shall not be taken away from her.
